event.title: 2001 census, 46.6% of the non-student resident population speak

data.event: According to the 2001 census, 46.6% of the non-student resident population speak Welsh, which is low for Gwynedd but despite this, the language keeps a high profile in town.

event.title: a monastic establishment on the site of Bangor Cathedral by the Celtic saint Deiniol in the early 6th century AD

data.event: The origins of the city date back to the founding of a monastic establishment on the site of Bangor Cathedral by the Celtic saint Deiniol in the early 6th century AD.

event.title: was founded as a free grammar school in 1557

data.event: Friars School was founded as a free grammar school in 1557, and Bangor University was founded in 1884.
Friars School was founded as a free grammar school in 1557, and Bangor University was founded in 1884.
